page.title: 17BEXLEYHILL
page.content: Huge pylons carry electricity across the area - SE to NW. Land for about 20 feet on either side of these electric wires is sterile. On{Bexleyhill}a {"booster"}has been set up to give a clearer television reception for viewers in the surrounding area. The red light surmounting the booster can, at night, be seen for miles around, and planes coming in from the South towards Heathrow Air Terminal use the light as a marker. Passengers are told, "We are now over Midhurst, in West Sussex. We shall be landing in a very short time."
